item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
New York based photographer, Elizabeth Watt, is continually re-inventing herself and re-discovering new ways to present her work to the public. mimoYmima has been her digital agency for many years and we couldn’t ask for a more admirable and prolific artist to have as a client Website Design Her tabletop photography is not just visually […]

The post Elizabeth Watt appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
New York based photographer, Elizabeth Watt, is continually re-inventing herself and re-discovering new ways to present her work to the public. mimoYmima has been her digital agency for many years and we couldn’t ask for a more admirable and prolific artist to have as a client

Website Design

Her tabletop photography is not just visually stunning, but it’s playful and creative – brimming with personality. You can see references to all types of artwork in her photography, from classical still-life that is meticulously arranged to modern/minimal masterpieces which make you look at simple objects in ways you never would have.

Her work has been published in countless national magazines and used by the largest agencies including BBDO, Real Simple, Oprah Magazine, Martha Stewart Living Magazine, Random House Books, Saatchi & Saatchi.

Branding Choices

We’ve been looking for an excuse to use the typeface Mrs. Eaves in a logo for a long time. The uppercase W is just the best thing ever, so it worked out good for Watt’s logo. Elizabeth’s identity is very simple and minimal and makes you see the type for all of it’s beauty:

Photo Blog Design

The post Elizabeth Watt appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Launch: Treehouse Reps
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
The site for Treehouse Reps is live and it looks pretty slick. We brought the identity work we created for them to life with some flash animation. The goal was to create a feeling of childhood innocence while at the same time keeping it looking very professional and polished.

item.title: Identity: Treehouse Reps.
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Check out some of the logos we've been working on for a California-based agency that represents children's photographers.

The post Identity: Treehouse Reps. appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We’ve been working on some logos for this California-based agency that represents children’s photographers.

Round 1

For round one we tried a bunch of different ideas and boiled it down to two logos we thought were very strong and were in very different styles.

Round 2

We tried some other variations of the first logo, here’s one of the better ones:

Round 3

We made a few changes and we’re down to three choices.

More Color…

Here’s our last minute attempt to add more color. Like Emeril would say, it needed to be kicked up a notch:

Two more

Final Logo Choice

I think we’ve got it!

The post Identity: Treehouse Reps. appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: LAUNCH: Rick Scott Photography
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We just launched Rick Scott's Photography Site and added some cool features we've never programmed into a flash photo site before.

The post LAUNCH: Rick Scott Photography appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
When you go to the Rick Scott’s Photography Site and navigate into the Collections section, you’ll get a quick note that comes up and tells you how to navigate through the images and collections with your keyboard.

Doing the extra work to get this feature in the site we feel was well worth the effort, and something we’ll probably be doing on a lot of future flash sites. The main perk is that the user can close the thumbnail navigation and give the entire browser window to the image (which is what they are there to see).

Personally I prefer to navigate photo sites using the keyboard because you don’t need to make sure your mouse stays hovered over an arrow or do the work to keep clicking from thumbnail to thumbnail… you just use the left and right arrow keys to advance through the photos and up and down to go between sets. It allows you to concentrate more on the photos than the navigating.

The post LAUNCH: Rick Scott Photography appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Rhea Karam’s Book – Breathing Walls
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Photographer Rhea Karam recently published a book of her photos from Beirut. We're helping her promote the book on her site and setup a simple way for people to buy it using PayPal.

The post Rhea Karam’s Book – Breathing Walls appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
Photographer Rhea Karam recently published a book of her photos from Beirut. We’re helping her promote the book on her site (which we re-designed last year).

BREATHING WALLS is a hard cover fine art photography book composed of 168 pages documenting the story of Lebanon through the walls of it’s streets.

The post Rhea Karam’s Book – Breathing Walls appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Ann Wilkinson Photography
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Type based identity For the typography, we chose Chaparral Pro, designed by Carol Twombly, a slab serif font that has some subtle wood-cut qualities that make it feel a little more down to earth and less trendy. It’s down to earth look is complimented with the bright and warm color scheme against the mid-toned grey […]

The post Ann Wilkinson Photography appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
Type based identity

For the typography, we chose Chaparral Pro, designed by Carol Twombly, a slab serif font that has some subtle wood-cut qualities that make it feel a little more down to earth and less trendy. It’s down to earth look is complimented with the bright and warm color scheme against the mid-toned grey background.

The post Ann Wilkinson Photography appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: North Ninth Studio
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Photographer Alison Gootee came back to us to create the branding and website for her daylight photo studio in Williamsburg, Brooklyn; North Ninth Studio. We wanted the look to be as bright and vibrant as the space, so we went with a clean ‘open-air’ look and feel. Check it out: Home Page Navigation

item.title: Alison Gootee
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We created the identity, some print work, and a website for Alison Gootee, a talented photographer working out of her daylight studio in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. A Gorgeous Type-based Logo We chose the self titled font Firmin Didot for it delicate and sophisticated qualities, paired with Zapf’s Optima, which both nicely matched Alison’s photographic style. Website […]

The post Alison Gootee appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We created the identity, some print work, and a website for Alison Gootee, a talented photographer working out of her daylight studio in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.

A Gorgeous Type-based Logo

We chose the self titled font Firmin Didot for it delicate and sophisticated qualities, paired with Zapf’s Optima, which both nicely matched Alison’s photographic style.

Website Design

The post Alison Gootee appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Laura Schair Photography
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We just finished designing a full set of print collateral for Laura Schair, a well known NYC based wedding photographer. Offset Printing This is our second big print job in a row (see Weidenbaum Development). We’ve been working with Nobel Printing in Manhattan and really love the attention to detail they give to their work, […]

The post Laura Schair Photography appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We just finished designing a full set of print collateral for Laura Schair, a well known NYC based wedding photographer.

Offset Printing

This is our second big print job in a row (see Weidenbaum Development). We’ve been working with Nobel Printing in Manhattan and really love the attention to detail they give to their work, working on-press with an offset printer is really exhilarating. They treat their work like an artform and you can really feel the history when you walk around their shop.

The post Laura Schair Photography appeared first on mimoYmima.
